result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon E. Ware II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Leon E. Ware II
Current: 133 W 2nd St Apt 2, Black River Falls, WI 54615-1947 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2017)
Prior: 214 S 3rd Street #11, Black River Falls, WI 54615
1 - Defendant's List of No Alcohol vs Drinking Alcohol

Defendant appears in person in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Travis Satorius.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Neither counsel note any corrections or additions to revocation summary.  State recommends the Court adopt DOC's recommendation:  Ct 2 - 9 months jail, concurrent to Count 3 - sentence to 90 days jail with credit for time previously served.  SPD Travis Satorius makes statement to the Court and marks Exhibit 1 - Defendant's list No Alcohol vs Drinking Alcohol.  Attorney Satorius reads a letter to the Court written by the defendant regarding how alcohol has affected his life.  Defense recommends AODA and treatment, should be given credit for the fact he completed DV Court, and recommends 6 months jail on battery and 30 days on disorderly conduct concurrent.  Defense asks for credit of 134 days served.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution and makes statement to the Court. 

Exhibit 1 is received and made part of the record.  Court orders on Count 2 - 6 months jail; Count 3 - 30 days in jail, consecutively to Count 2.  Credit for 134 days served.  Judgment entered for unpaid court costs and enter tax intercept.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Plea & Sentencing Hearing held on 2-24-16

records.addlTxt: DV court.  Petition to discharge.  Reviewed by court.  Discharged from DV court.
DV court.  He filed for unemployment yesterday.  He contacted Ashley about going back to them.  Keep trying to find employment.  Pick up petition for discharge today.
DV court.  Worked at Crust Unlimited yesterday in Osseo.  Discussion on how new schedule will work with appointments.  Talk to T.M.  Keep making progress.

DV court.  Has been drinking and texting the no contact.  He lost his job at Ashley.  He has a new job through People Link.  32-40 hours per week.  Let agent know about employment.  Talk to Lisa about drinking.  He has seen her since he got out of jail.  Discussion on the no contact order.  Start testing at the JASO kiosk.  Talk to agent.
DV court.  Final project done with B.G.  One more class this week.
DV court.  Going good.  Week 27 with B.G.  Started on his final project.
DV Court - Discussed his employment.  He enjoys his classes with L.  Good report from B.

DV Court - Discussed his employment and what he's doing there.  Can't transfer anywhere else until after Dec 4.  Working 38 - 58 hours per week.  Has received a call from Rozario's.  States he really likes to see and discuss things with L.  B.G.'s class is going alright.
Recorded by FTR.  DV court.  Employment good.  Nine classes left with B.G.
DV court.  Working at Ashley, lots of hours.  Seeing someone at human services on Mondays.  Good job.

Hearing recorded - DV Court

Feels he's doing better in the program and taking it more seriously.  Keep up the good work.
DV court.  Work going good.  Working 60+ hours per week.  Discussion on coping.
DV court.  He is still contacting D.L.  If he contacts her again, jail will be ordered.  Did homework.  He shared what he wrote.  Group discussion.

DV court.  Another rough week.  Write up something for his agent on 10 different alternatives on how he can react in a non-violent, appropriate way.  Agent has a form he can use.  Set up appointment with agent.

DV Court - Has called HCN and JCHSD several times regarding scheduling assessment and no one has called him back.  Judge instructed him to call JCHSD again and what to ask for.  Teresa will also call HSD.  He is to contact Teresa after he makes the contact.
DV Court.  Report to kiosk everyday starting tomorrow.  Having problems with person who is not supposed to have contact with.  Talk to B.G.

DV court.  Didn't get to appointment with agent at the correct time.  Missed class with B.G.  Missed 3 out of 5.  Miss one more class, he will have to start over, or he will be revoked from probation.

DV court.  He had positive test with agent.  He was demoted at work.  3 day sanction ordered.  He will talk to his manager and he can schedule his jail time.  Let agent know when he can serve by Friday.  Must start by Friday at 6:00 pm at the latest.  Give assignment to agent.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction.
DV court.  He got a call the AM from Human Services regarding visitation.   1 hour late for B.G.'s class.  Keep a calendar.   One more miss and you have to start over.  3 day sanction starting today.

DV Court - still maintaining employment.  Court reminded him of the 2 no contacts that he has and some other conditions of probation.  Discussed family issues and how to make things work.  He is to talk to jail personnel regarding kiosk after court today.
DV Court - just completed serving a sanction.  Court reviewed rules and expectations of program and warned him of consequences.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Randtke.  Plead guilty to counts 2 and 3.  Dismiss and read in remaining counts and case No. 15CM282.    Joint recommendation for probation.  Victim notification complied with by the State.  No restitution request.  Court advised the possible penalties of the charges the defendant is pleading to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of the charges plead to.  Counts 1, 4, 5, 6 and 15CM282 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 18 mo probation.    No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victim:  D.L., unless approved by agent for child custody visitation issues.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for employment.  AODA.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DV programming.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 18 months probation.    Contact with the victim:  D.L., if any,  is at agent's discretion.  Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located, except for employment purposes only.  AODA.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  DV programming, if agent recommends. CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  Domestic surcharge.  Not to terminate employment without agent's prior approval.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: the victim, D.L.
